question_content.barrons:question: The author’s attitude towards Goethe’s writing is best described as
question_content.barrons:explanation:
measured admiration.

The author both admires Goethe’s writings and notes their flaws; his attitude is one of measured admiration.

Unqualified endorsement is incorrect. The author qualifies (places limits on) his endorsement (approval) of Goethe’s writing by making a point of noting their flaws.

Lofty indifference is incorrect. The author is not indifferent to Goethe’s writings; he cares about his subject matter.

Reluctant tolerance is incorrect. The author does not merely tolerate (endure; accept) Goethe’s writings; in general, he admires them.

Undisguised contempt is incorrect. The author does not view Goethe’s writings with contempt (scorn); in general, he admires them.
